intro: Palicourea veracruzensis, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Palicourea veracruzensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
